item.title: Hot Water Balloon
Igalia, Servo, and the Sovereign Tech Fund | Igalia
item.description: Igalia is an open source consultancy specialised in the development of innovative projects and solutions. Our engineers have expertise in a wide range of technological areas, including browsers and client-side web technologies, graphics pipeline, compilers and virtual machines. We have the most WPE, WebKit, Chromium/Blink and Firefox expertise found in the consulting business, including many reviewers and committers. Igalia designs, develops, customises and optimises GNU/Linux-based solutions for companies across the globe. Our work and contributions are present in many projects such as GStreamer, Mesa 3D, WebKit, Chromium, etc.
item.author: (https://www.igalia.com/about/)

item.title: Cubemaps // Vulkan For Beginners #25
item.description:
In this video we learn how to implement Cubemapping in Vulkan. This can be used to render a skybox around the viewer.
üî• See the list of the books that I'm using as background information for my tutorials: https://ogldev.org/books.html. I highly recommend them for learning more about OpenGL and Vulkan. These are affiliate links so if you use them to buy any of the books the price is the same for you and I will get a small commission (thank-you!).
üìö Timecodes üìö 0:00 Intro 0:36 The Skybox class 3:04 Initialize the Skybox 5:53 Creating the texture 9:40 Shader handles and pipeline 11:44 Populating the descriptor sets 13:14 Command buffer recording 14:00 Uniform buffer update 14:18 Vertex shader 15:16 Fragment shader 15:45 App integration 16:47 Outro
Make sure to watch all the previous tutorials in the "Vulkan For Beginners" playlist at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLA0dXqQjCx0RntJy1pqje9uHRF1Z5vZgA
Please visit https://ogldev.org to see more of my tutorials on modern OpenGL.
üî•Link to source: https://github.com/emeiri/ogldev/tree/master/Vulkan/Tutorial25 If you want to get the same version of the code that was used in the video checkout the tag 'VULKAN_25'
üî•Vulkan specification: https://vulkan.lunarg.com/doc/view/1.3.204.1/windows/1.3-extensions/vkspec.html
Feel free to comment below.
üîóContacts: üîπEmail: ogldev1@gmail.com üîπInstagram: @ogldev1 üîπGithub: https://github.com/emeiri/ogldev.git üîπTikTok - https://www.tiktok.com/@ogldev üîπTwitter: @ogldev üîπDiscord: https://discord.gg/CZdVwZgTYk üîπOne time donations (Paypal): https://ogldev.org/donate.html üîπPatreon: https://www.patreon.com/ogldev
üôèCredits: üîπMusic I Use: https://www.bensound.com/free-music-for-videos License code: H6PSNAHABCXMJCDE Artist: : Benjamin Lazzarus
Enjoy,
Etay Meiri
#vulkan

item.title: AI Coding Sucks
item.description:
AI coding tools suck and are not at all what was promised. I'm done.
00:00 - intro 00:15 - i used to enjoy programming 01:05 - why did I become a programmer 01:55 - AI / LLMs are not predictable 02:47 - models are magic boxes 03:26 - ai programming has become a religion 04:05 - what I've learned and know about working with AI coding tools 04:21 - agents.md / rules 05:38 - make a plan before coding 06:16 - validate the plan 06:49 - use spec driven workflows 07:36 - work on small features not big sweeping changes 07:52 - use AI to write tests / use interactive debugging MCPs 08:17 - AI models are goal seeking 09:11 - use agentic workflows to prevent context bloat 10:13 - how i use AI summary 10:39 - FOMO based development 11:40 - what to do as a new programmer? 12:12 - everything is competing for your attention / money 12:43 - all AI tools are wrappers for foundational models + slight edge 13:15 - use the tools that work 13:40 - what now? 14:24 - what are you going to do? 15:16 - thanks!
üî• Be the ~14,700th person to join our super tasty newsletter https://bit.ly/syntax_snackpack ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Hit us up on Socials! Syntax: https://x.com/syntaxfm Scott: https://x.com/stolinski Wes: https://x.com/wesbos CJ: https://x.com/CodingGarden Randy: https://www.youtube.com/@randyrektor
